introduction.title: What is Magic: The Gathering?
introduction.description: Magic: The Gathering, also Magic or MTG, is a strategy card game created by Richard Garfield in 1993, and published by Wizards of the Coast.[1][2]
introduction.tagline: The world's first and most popular trading card game

basics.players: Typically played between 2 players, though multiplayer formats exist
basics.ageRange: Recommended for ages 13+, though simpler formats work for younger players
basics.skillTypes: Combines strategy, deck building, resource management, and tactical decision-making

coreGameplay.overview: Players cast spells by paying mana - magical energy that comes from lands. Different colours of mana (White, Blue, Black, Red, Green) represent different types of magic, each with their own strengths and strategies.
coreGameplay.gameFlow: The game combines strategy, deck building, and a bit of luck as you draw cards from your library and adapt to your opponent's plays. Victory comes through reducing your opponent's life to zero, though alternative win conditions exist.
coreGameplay.strategy: Success requires understanding when to play cards, how to manage your resources, and predicting your opponent's moves. Each game presents unique decisions and interactions.

whyPlay.diversity: With over 20,000 unique cards printed, every game feels different
whyPlay.community: Join millions of players worldwide in local game stores, online, or at home
whyPlay.formats: Multiple ways to play suit different preferences and budgets
whyPlay.creativity: Express yourself through deck building and unique strategies
whyPlay.competitive: From casual kitchen table games to professional tournaments
whyPlay.collectible: Beautiful artwork and the thrill of opening new cards

gettingStarted.step1: Start with a preconstructed deck or Magic Arena (the digital version)
gettingStarted.step2: Learn the basic rules and phases of a turn
gettingStarted.step3: Practice with friends or at your local game store
gettingStarted.step5: Build your own deck as you learn what you enjoy

keyTerms.planeswalker: What players are called in the Magic multiverse - powerful spellcasters who can travel between worlds
keyTerms.mana: The magical energy used to cast spells, produced by lands
keyTerms.library: Your deck of cards that you draw from during the game
keyTerms.battlefield: The area where permanents (creatures, artefacts, etc.) exist and can interact
keyTerms.graveyard: Where cards go when they're destroyed or used up
keyTerms.stack: The area where spells wait to resolve, allowing players to respond to each other
